pedals.name: Vox AC15 Normal
pedals.story: Vox AC15 Normal — A classic Vox-style clean-to-crunch amp voice: bright, chiming mids with that tight low end. Great as a ‘platform’ at the end of a board—push it with drives and it bites back without getting flubby. Vox AC15 Normal Channel — Pro Full amp model: EF86 pentode preamp → 12AX7 driver → FX loop → 12AX7 cathodyne phase inverter → EL84 Class A power → output transformer The Normal channel (not Top Boost) — warmer, less trebly, pairs beautifully with humbuckers. Adds chime and harmonic complexity without harshness. fx_send / fx_return mark the preamp/power amp boundary for FX loop insertion. Component values match the original 1960 AC15 schematic.

pedals.name: Boss CE-2 Chorus
pedals.story: Boss CE-2 Chorus — Warm, liquid BBD chorus with the subtle wobble that makes clean parts feel wide without sounding ‘effecty’. Use it slow for shimmer, faster for 80s motion. Boss CE-2 Chorus (Pro) Classic analog chorus using MN3207 BBD delay line LFO modulates the BBD clock for time-varying delay (chorus effect) TL072 op-amp input buffer, triangle LFO, proper wet/dry mix Depth knob scales LFO modulation amount via series resistor

pedals.name: Keeley Compressor Plus
pedals.story: Keeley Compressor Plus — A musical compressor for evening out pick attack without killing dynamics. Dial it for country snap, funk consistency, or just ‘make it feel like a record’ sustain. Keeley Compressor Plus — Pro Modified Ross/Dyna Comp topology with attack and blend controls CA3080 OTA (operational transconductance amplifier) for smooth compression Envelope follower drives the OTA's gain control current Blend pot crossfades dry/compressed for parallel compression

pedals.name: Boss DM-2 Delay
pedals.story: Boss DM-2 Delay — Analog BBD-style delay: dark repeats, gentle smear, and that satisfying decay into noise. Perfect for slapback, dotted-eighths, or ambient trails that don’t fight the dry signal. Boss DM-2 Analog Delay — Pro MN3005 BBD-based warm analog delay The DM-2 uses a 4096-stage BBD for long delay times Anti-alias and reconstruction filters tame clock noise Feedback loop with coupling cap for repeats

pedals.name: Noise Gate
pedals.story: Noise Gate — A practical noise gate to clamp hiss and high-gain rumble between notes. Set it as lightly as possible—just enough to clean up pauses without choking sustain. Optical Noise Gate — Pro Envelope follower detects signal level and drives a photocoupler (VTL5C1) When signal drops below threshold, the LDR goes high-impedance and blocks signal VTL5C1: fast 50ms release, r_dark=600k, r_light=600 ohm — tight gating Attack 1ms / Release 80ms — fast open, moderate close to avoid chatter

pedals.name: EQD Plumes
pedals.story: EQD Plumes — TS-style drive with a more open top end and LED-style bite. Great for pushing an amp, stacking into another overdrive, or tightening the low end for modern rhythm. --- pk: schema: 1 kind: pedal id: eqd_plumes name: "EQD Plumes" vendor: "EarthQuaker Devices" model: "Plumes" type: overdrive subtype: "ts-style" summary: "Tube Screamer-inspired overdrive with LED clipping for higher headroom" tags: [ts-style, led-clipping, mid-hump] links: - title: "Official product page" url: "https://www.earthquakerdevices.com/plumes" controls: - id: Gain label: Gain default: 0.5 range: [0.0, 1.0] - id: Tone label: Tone default: 0.5 range: [0.0, 1.0] - id: Level label: Level default: 0.7 range: [0.0, 1.0] --- EarthQuaker Devices Plumes — Pro TS-style overdrive with LED clipping for higher headroom Based on the Tube Screamer topology but uses LEDs instead of silicon diodes LEDs have higher forward voltage (~1.8V vs ~0.6V) = more headroom, more open dynamics Anti-parallel LED diodes in feedback loop (soft clipping)

pedals.name: Fulltone OCD
pedals.story: Fulltone OCD — A punchy MOSFET-style overdrive with amp-like feel—wide bandwidth, strong pick response, and a satisfying ‘crunch’ when you dig in. Fulltone OCD (Obsessive Compulsive Drive) V1.7 — Pro MOSFET-based overdrive/distortion with amp-like transparency Uses 2N7000 MOSFET pair for clipping (the OCD's signature) JFET input buffer, op-amp gain stage, MOSFET clipping to ground HP/LP toggle modeled as tone control position

pedals.name: Klon Centaur
pedals.story: Klon Centaur — The transparent drive: keeps your core tone, adds harmonic sheen, and pushes mids in a flattering way. Ideal as an always-on sweetener or a clean boost into an already-breaking amp. Klon Centaur Professional Overdrive (1994) — Pro Bill Finnegan's legendary "transparent" overdrive TL072 dual op-amp with germanium diodes in anti-parallel in feedback loop Unique gain/clean blend architecture with charge pump headroom

pedals.name: JHS Morning Glory
pedals.story: JHS Morning Glory — Bluesbreaker-flavored overdrive—low to mid gain, smooth compression, and a polished top end. It’s the ‘edge of breakup’ sound in a box. JHS Morning Glory — Pro Marshall Bluesbreaker-style transparent overdrive Dual op-amp circuit with soft clipping diodes in anti-parallel in feedback loop Known for touch-sensitive, amp-like breakup that cleans up with guitar volume

pedals.name: Ibanez TS808
pedals.story: Ibanez TS808 — The archetypal mid-hump overdrive: soft clipping, tightened bass, and a focused EQ that helps leads sit in a mix and makes high-gain amps feel tighter. Ibanez TS808 Tube Screamer (Original 1979) — Pro JRC4558D dual op-amp with symmetric soft clipping in feedback loop Famous for the "mid-hump" EQ and smooth, compressed overdrive Key: Diodes are in the FEEDBACK loop (soft clipping), not to ground

pedals.name: Wampler Tumnus
pedals.story: Wampler Tumnus — A compact Klon-inspired drive with a bit more modern clarity. Use it to add presence and push, especially when stacking into other gain stages. Wampler Tumnus — Pro Modern Klon-inspired transparent overdrive Same topology as Klon Centaur but with silicon diodes for consistency Clean/dirty blend architecture, active treble EQ

pedals.name: MXR Phase 90
pedals.story: MXR Phase 90 — A four-stage phaser with that chewy sweep—subtle at low rates, psychedelic at higher settings. Great for single notes, chords, and classic rock motion. MXR Phase 90 — Pro 4-stage JFET allpass phaser with single speed control Four J201 N-channel JFETs as variable resistors in RC allpass networks Swept by triangle LFO for classic slow, romantic phaser sound

pedals.name: Uni-Vibe
pedals.story: Uni-Vibe — Swirly photocell vibe with a deep, pulsing throb. It’s chorus-adjacent but more organic—perfect for Hendrix flavors and slow, seasick movement. Shin-Ei Uni-Vibe — Pro 4-stage JFET phaser with staggered caps for non-uniform phase shifts The Uni-Vibe's unique character comes from the staggered capacitor values (15n, 22n, 47n, 100n) which create an uneven, chorus-like phasing effect LFO through depth control, with chorus/vibrato mix for dry blend

pedals.name: Walrus Audio Slo
pedals.story: Walrus Audio Slo — Dreamy, modulated reverb textures designed for ambient playing. Big tails, movement, and ‘pad-like’ sustain for swells, post-rock, and cinematic washes. Walrus Audio Slo — Pro Multi-texture ambient reverb using BBD delay network MN3005 BBD (4096 stages) provides the reverb delay Heavy feedback loop for sustain/decay with filtering for progressive darkening Subtle LFO modulation on BBD clock for shimmer

pedals.name: Fender Tremolo
pedals.story: Fender Tremolo — Vintage Fender-style tremolo with smooth amplitude modulation. From gentle shimmer to hard chop, it’s a simple way to add motion that stays musical. Fender Tremolo (Bias-Vary) — Pro Classic Fender amp-style bias-vary tremolo JFET used as voltage-controlled attenuator LFO modulates JFET vgs to vary signal amplitude Triangle wave for smooth, classic tremolo character

pedals.name: Harmonic Tremolo
pedals.story: Harmonic Tremolo — Brownface-style harmonic trem: splits the signal into bands and alternates them for a lush, phasey pulse. It feels like tremolo and phaser had a classy child. Harmonic Tremolo (Brownface Fender Style) — Pro Dual-band JFET tremolo with anti-phase modulation Splits signal into high/low bands via active crossover Each band is modulated by JFETs in anti-phase (180 degrees apart) When lows are loud, highs are soft and vice versa — phase-y, lush character

pedals.name: Optical Tremolo
pedals.story: Optical Tremolo — Optical tremolo with a round, lamp-like response—soft edges and a natural bounce. Great for surf, indie, and anything that wants movement without harsh gating. Optical Tremolo (Blackface Fender Style) — Pro True photocoupler-based tremolo using LED/LDR for soft amplitude modulation The VTL5C3 photocoupler's nonlinear response creates the classic smooth, syrupy character LFO drives the photocoupler LED; signal flows through the LDR

pedals.name: Dunlop Cry Baby
pedals.story: Dunlop Cry Baby — Classic inductor wah for vocal, resonant sweeps. Use it for funk quack, lead emphasis, or slow filter sweeps for dramatic tone shifts. Dunlop Cry Baby GCB-95 Wah — Pro NPN transistor gain stage with inductor-based resonant bandpass filter MPSA18 high-gain NPN drives the Fasel inductor + cap resonant circuit Wah pot sweeps the resonant frequency by varying the Q loading The inductor + cap form a tuned circuit; the pot shifts the peak

boards.name: Ambient Shoegaze
boards.story: Ambient Shoegaze — Wide, washed-out ambience for wall-of-sound chords and soaring leads. Modulation into long delays and reverb—let notes blur into a moving pad. Shoegaze / ambient wall-of-sound Phaser into Big Muff into reverb with heavy sustain

boards.name: Boutique Transparent
boards.story: Boutique Transparent — A touch-sensitive ‘expensive clean’ chain: subtle compression, transparent drive, and polish. Designed to feel like your amp got better overnight. Stacked transparent overdrives Tumnus into Morning Glory for dynamic response

boards.name: Classic Rock Stack
boards.story: Classic Rock Stack — A straightforward rock rig: pushy drive into a chewy mod/delay. Built for riffs, choruses, and solos that cut without sounding modern or scooped. 70s British rock tones Morning Glory into Big Muff

boards.name: Classic Wah Drive
boards.story: Classic Wah Drive — Wah into a responsive drive for classic lead phrasing. Think vocal sweeps, dynamic attack, and that instantly recognizable ‘talking guitar’ feel. Classic wah-into-drive (Clapton / Slash style) Cry Baby into transparent overdrive for vocal lead tones

boards.name: Edge U2 Dotted Eighth
boards.story: Edge U2 Dotted Eighth — Dotted-eighth delay rhythms for shimmering arpeggios. Tight repeats and controlled ambience so the groove stays defined. The Edge's U2 rig - Dotted eighth note delay shimmer Compressor into transparent drive into analog delay

boards.name: Funk Rhythm
boards.story: Funk Rhythm — Snappy, tight, and clean—built for percussive right-hand playing. Compression and filtering-style motion to make muted rhythms pop. Funk / R&B rhythm rig Compressor into wah (parked) into optical tremolo - tight and percussive

boards.name: Gilmour Dark Side
boards.story: Gilmour Dark Side — Big, spacious lead tones with modulation and delay that bloom. Smooth sustain and width for melodic lines that feel cinematic. David Gilmour - Dark Side of the Moon era Phaser into Fuzz Face into analog delay into tremolo

boards.name: Harmonic Trem Ambient
boards.story: Harmonic Trem Ambient — Lush harmonic tremolo into ambience: pulsing movement that turns simple chords into evolving texture. Ambient harmonic tremolo rig Compressor into light drive into harmonic tremolo into reverb

boards.name: Hendrix Uni-Vibe
boards.story: Hendrix Uni-Vibe — Univibe-forward swirl with just enough gain to sing. A psychedelic, chewy motion that loves single notes and double-stops. Jimi Hendrix - Band of Gypsys era Wah into Fuzz Face into Uni-Vibe with chorus mode

boards.name: High Gain Crunch
boards.story: High Gain Crunch — Tight, modern crunch with controlled noise and focused low end. Built for palm-mutes, aggressive rhythms, and punchy lead sustain. Modern rock/metal gain stack OCD into RAT for tight distortion

boards.name: Indie Alt Rock
boards.story: Indie Alt Rock — A versatile indie chain: edge-of-breakup drive, tasteful modulation, and medium delay. Works for jangly cleans through gritty choruses. 90s-2000s alternative rock tones Big Muff into Blues Driver

boards.name: Jazz Clean
boards.story: Jazz Clean — Clean, even dynamics with gentle sweetening. Designed for articulation, warm chords, and a polished tone that stays out of the way. Jazz clean - warm and articulate Light compression, chorus shimmer, touch of reverb

boards.name: John Mayer Continuum
boards.story: John Mayer Continuum — Glassier blues tones: light compression, transparent drive, and that ‘strat into a good amp’ elasticity. Responsive to touch and volume knob. John Mayer's Continuum-era pedalboard Keeley Compressor into dual Tube Screamers

boards.name: Late Night
boards.story: Late Night — Low-noise, mix-friendly tones for quiet playing. Smoother top end, controlled dynamics, and ambience that feels big without being loud.

boards.name: Modern Blues
boards.story: Modern Blues — A modern blues board: touch-sensitive drive with space and a little motion. Cleans up well and stacks naturally for solos. Contemporary blues rig Klon-style drive into Tube Screamer

boards.name: Nashville Session
boards.story: Nashville Session — Studio-ready consistency: compression into a polite drive with time-based polish. Built to sit in a track without harsh peaks. Studio-ready Nashville session tone Compression into transparent drive

boards.name: Psychedelic 60s
boards.story: Psychedelic 60s — Slow sweeps, swirling modulation, and warm repeats. Designed for trippy chords, melodic hooks, and that saturated 60s movement. 1960s psychedelic rig Uni-Vibe into optical tremolo into tape-style delay - wobbly and warped

boards.name: SRV Texas Flood
boards.story: SRV Texas Flood — Punchy mid-forward blues drive with dynamics intact. Thick, sustaining lead tone that still has string-to-string clarity. Stevie Ray Vaughan's Texas Flood Rig Tube Screamer stacked into Fuzz Face

boards.name: Surf Rock
boards.story: Surf Rock — Bright, splashy, and rhythmic: classic tremolo and space for springy vibes. Great for staccato picking and big open chords. Dick Dale surf rock rig Chorus into tremolo into spring reverb - dripping wet

boards.name: Worship Ambient
boards.story: Worship Ambient — Big, clean worship ambience: controlled compression into gentle drive, spacious repeats, and lush reverb for pads and swells. Worship / ambient lead tones Stacked transparent drives into delay and reverb
